holidays.name: Purple Heart Day
holidays.description: A day to honor and remember the recipients of the Purple Heart medal — awarded to U.S. military personnel wounded or killed in combat.
holidays.origin: Established by the U.S. Congress in 1932 to commemorate the original Badge of Military Merit created by George Washington in 1782.
holidays.funFact: The Purple Heart is the oldest military award still given to U.S. service members, with its design inspired by George Washington's family coat of arms.

holidays.name: National Lighthouse Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the history and importance of lighthouses, those iconic beacons guiding ships through treacherous waters.
holidays.origin: Chosen because August 7th marks the birthday of Augustin-Jean Fresnel, a French physicist who invented the lighthouse lens system in 1823.
holidays.funFact: The Fresnel lens allows a lighthouse to be seen from over 20 miles away—without it, many ships would have been lost at sea!

holidays.name: Friendship Day (International)
holidays.description: A quirky celebration encouraging people around the world to honor friendship and show appreciation for their pals.
holidays.origin: First proposed by the World Friendship Crusade in 1958, and recognized by the UN and many countries on various dates; August 7 is often observed globally.
holidays.funFact: In some countries, friendship bracelets exchanged on Friendship Day are believed to bring good luck and strengthen bonds forever!

holidays.name: National Tattoo Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day devoted to celebrating the art of tattoos and the stories etched into skin around the world.
holidays.origin: Became popular as tattoo culture grew more mainstream, with August 7th chosen by enthusiasts to admire the creative expression of body art.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known tattooed human skin belongs to Ötzi the Iceman, dating back over 5,000 years!
